TF023571-DUTCH GRANT FOR ESSENTIAL
            HOSPITAL SERVICES IN BHZ,TF021087-ITALY - BHZ-ESSENTIAL HOSPITAL SERVICES,TF024084-BOSNIA & HERZEGOVINA -
            ESSENTIAL HOSPITAL SERVICES PROJECT,TF020873-RECONSTRUCTION PROGRAM
            PREPARATION (BANK EX.)

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings convey a satisfactory project
            outcome, likely sustainability, and substantial
            institutional development impacts. Some lessons drawn from
            the project convey the following. Post conflict environments
            present a high risk regarding finance plans, and funding
            capacity; thus, agreements should be formalized a priori,
            since for example, in the case of the Department for
            International Cooperation's (DFID) involvement
            concerning the health financing system studies, the absence
            of an agreement, resulted in the breakdown of this work, a
            fact aggravated by the Government's weak capacity to
            make financial commitments. In addition, the local capacity
            should be assessed prior to project preparation, and the
            Bank should ensure the necessary capacity building to assist
            implementing agencies, through training and
            consultant's assistance at the very early stages.
            Although introduction of reforms in post-conflict situations
            is seemingly, unlikely to succeed promptly, the reform
            process initiated under this project demonstrates the
            practicality of such move, rather than waiting for the
            appropriate political situation - which may take too long to materialize.
